abstract: An internal memo claimed that the company saved millions by negotiating with U.S. regulators on a limited recall of floor mats.
snippet: An internal memo claimed that the company saved millions by negotiating with U.S. regulators on a limited recall of floor mats.
lead_paragraph: Toyota estimated that it saved $100 million by negotiating with regulators for a limited recall of 2007 Toyota Camry and Lexus ES models for sudden acceleration, the same problem that has since prompted it to recall millions of cars, documents turned over to a Congressional committee showed Sunday.

headline.main: Toyota Cited $100 Million Savings After Limiting Recall
headline.print_headline: Toyota Cited Its Savings In a Recall

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: LEXUS DIVISION OF TOYOTA MOTOR SALES USA

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

abstract: Mainland China’s stock market, open for the first time since the weeklong Lunar New Year holiday, slipped on Monday, while markets elsewhere in the region rallied as investors digested the impact of recent moves by the U.S. and Chinese central banks.
snippet: Mainland China’s stock market, open for the first time since the weeklong Lunar New Year holiday, slipped on Monday, while markets elsewhere in the region rallied as investors digested the impact of recent moves by the U.S. and Chinese central ban...
lead_paragraph: Mainland China’s stock market, open for the first time since the weeklong Lunar New Year holiday, slipped on Monday, while markets elsewhere in the region rallied as investors digested the impact of recent moves by the United States and Chinese central banks, Bettina Wassener reports in The New York Times.

abstract: Democrats said that Toyota made misleading statements on repairs it said would fix an accelerator problem.
snippet: Democrats said that Toyota made misleading statements on repairs it said would fix an accelerator problem.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Leading Democrats on the House Energy and Commerce Committee said Monday that Toyota relied on a flawed study in dismissing the notion that computer issues could be at fault for sticking accelerator pedals, and then made misleading statements about the repairs.

headline.main: House Panel Says Toyota Misled Public on Safety
headline.print_headline: House Panel Faults Toyota Response to Accelerator Complaints
